heisigStory: Note the clearer outline of a triangular mountain here.
koohiiStory1: Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example).
koohiiStory2: YOU CAN´T POSSIBLY NEED A MNEMONIC FOR THIS!!!!
words: to romp, to gambol, to frolic, to joke, to make fun of, to flirt
mountain, pile, heap, climax, critical point
